15 years ago I started posting my income online, it was such a weird thing The New York Times did a full-page piece on it.

That concept has now iterated into a cool trend called #buildinpublic where people start a project and document every step, and often income numbers.

If you are a solo founder in the process of making a product, a word of advice.

Put your app on a subdomain.

You won’t have time to hand code your marketing pages.

Stick a #NoCode tool on your main domain to rapidly build them.

I’m just learning this now

Cold DMs 

People I've DM-ed said I was effective. 

Principles + template in : 
- Keep it short and concise
- Use spacing for visual
- Don't give them a reason to say no
- Be human and build a relationship
- Act of service always

How to launch your startup:

 Twitter:
Regular updates with #BuildInpublic

 Reddit:
Explain the problem + Solution

 HackerNews & IndieHackers:
Explain how/why you built it

 Linkedin:
Problem + Entrepreneur story

 ProductHunt:
Problem + Why you + Your Solution
